4DS.DE.summary: Daldrup & SÃ¶hne Aktiengesellschaft, together with its subsidiaries, provides drilling and environmental services to industries, suppliers, municipal/government bodies, and private customers in Germany and Central Europe. The company operates through four business units: Geothermal Energy, Raw Materials & Exploration, Water Procurement and Environment, and Development & Services (EDS). The Geothermal Energy business unit provides drilling services for near-surface geothermal energy, primarily geothermal probes for heat pumps; and drilling services for deep geothermal energy. The Raw Materials & Exploration business unit explores deposits of fossil fuels, such oil and gas and mineral raw materials, which include salts, ores, copper, nickel, zinc, and limestone; and explores and secures substratum in mining areas. The Water Procurement business unit engages in drilling wells for the procurement of drinking water, process water, thermal and mineral water, boiler feedwater, and cooling water, as well as thermal brine. The EDS business unit offers environmental technology services for various clients related to the hydraulic remediation of contaminated sites, the planning and construction of gas extraction wells for obtaining landfill gas, the provision of groundwater quality measurement points, or the construction of water purification plants. Daldrup & SÃ¶hne Aktiengesellschaft is headquartered in GrÃ¼nwald, Germany.

DR0.DE.summary: Deutsche Rohstoff AG, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the exploration and production of crude oil, and natural gas primarily in North America, Australia, and Europe. It also explores for and develops metal properties, including gold, copper, rare earth elements, tungsten, and tin. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Mannheim, Germany.

DRJ.F.short_name: DE RAJ GROUP AG INH O.N.
DRJ.F.summary: De Raj Group AG, through its subsidiaries, operates in the oil and gas business in Asia and Europe. It provides various solutions for the monetization of oil and gas fields for National oil companies, companies having stakes in oil fields, and other technological enterprises in the South East Asian region. The company has a range of assets comprising jack-up rigs, drilling equipment, processing equipment, and marine equipment that handles offshore oil and gas extraction and production for green fields, brown fields, and marginal fields. The company is based in Cologne, Germany.

HMU.DE.summary: HMS Bergbau AG distributes coal and other energy raw materials to power plants, cement manufacturers, and industrial consumers worldwide. The company offers steam coal, coking coal and coke, and anthracite and PCI coal; wood pellets, wood chips, and other biomass; iron ore, including pellets, iron lumps, fines, and other ores; cement and cementitious products, such as clinker, fly ash, etc.; and sea, rail, and road logistics services. It also provides consulting services in the areas of power plant design and construction, harbor planning and configuration, coal mine operation, and on-site optimization of raw materials logistics. In addition, the company charters sea going vessels and inland barges; and organizes logistics by barge, train, or truck; and provides logistics solutions comprising harbor operations, storage management, and technical oversight. It supplies its products to power plant companies, as well as steel and cement manufacturers; and industrial companies, such as glassworks, paper mills, and waste processing plants. HMS Bergbau AG was founded in 1995 and is headquartered in Berlin, Germany.

NXI.MU.summary: Activa Resources AG, an independent oil and gas company, engages in the acquisition, development, and exploitation of oil and natural gas properties in the North America. The company primarily holds a 22.1% interest in the OSR-Halliday project covering 16,400 acres located in Leon and Madison counties, East Texas. As of January 1, 2016, it had proved reserves of 6.52 million barrels of oil equivalent. The company was formerly known as TNG Capital Invest AG and changed its name to Activa Resources AG in January 2005. Activa Resources AG was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Bad Homburg, Germany.
